lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We play Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We are already in top form tonight, if you couldn't tell. Before we go ahead and jump into our story, let's go ahead and get through some announcements for the evening. First, we have two wonderful sponsors tonight, beginning with our friends, who have continued through the first part of this campaign and to the new year, D&D Beyond. Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond! Is the camera on me? I can't tell. It is on me! D&D Beyond, everybody. Last week we kicked off my campaign to become president of D&D Beyond. That campaign will continue through a lot of the year. We have lots of big things planned, but the campaign is taking a week off this week. Instead, I spent most of this week making an infomercial for our good friends at D&D Beyond. I shot, I edited it, I added music. It's a really cool piece. It talks about all the great features of D&D Beyond, how it streamlines game-play, and you should all go subscribe to it right now at dndbeyond.com. Anyway, I made this infomercial. I'm going to give it to Max right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am so nervous right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wake me up, okay? (kiss noise) Love you, baby. Bye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (retching)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now that I'm thinking about it, I think that was the other thumb drive that I left at home, and I think this one-- Max, I apologize. I think this one's on me, so I apologize, and I apologize to D&D Beyond. Please subscribe now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Technically still awesome stuff, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't unsee that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't let Travis lie to you; he's got a half-er.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am doing the forward lean.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I thought I felt it under the table.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, D&D Beyond, for being our fantastic sponsor in spite of Sam Riegel giving your announcements every week.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they still our sponsor? Can we check on that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, they have canceled the contract.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All of our pages are blank.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam is not doing this next intro. As for our second sponsor tonight, our friends at Idle Champions. For those who aren't familiar with Idle Champions-- Idle Champions of the Forgotten Realms is the full name of it. It's a D&D strategy video game that brings a variety of popular D&D characters together for the first time in one world. You can play it on PC, Steam and mobile, iPad and Android, but apparently now it's available on Xbox and PS4, which is awesome. You have characters from Drizzt of the Forgotten Realms all the way up to Arkhan, who you saw--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Cruel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On next Wednesday, January 23rd at 5:00pm Pacific, here on our Twitch channel, here at Critical Role, tune into Pub Draw--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pub Draw!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The new creative series featuring art lessons from our fantastic friend of the family, Babs Tarr. She teaches Marisha and then other members of the extended family how to draw. And you as well, as you follow along and do your own artwork. Between the Sheets is coming back very soon. The first episode of season two of Between the Sheets airs on Monday January 28th and 7:00pm Pacific here at twitch.tv/criticalrole. It's going to be awesome. This whole next season's awesome, so look forward to that. January 18th to the 20th, this weekend-- tomorrow! Saturday and Sunday, at Gallery Nucleus in Los Angeles, we have the Art of Exandria art show. We've been wanting to do an art show for so long, it's our first time actually being able to get it done! We saw pictures today; the setup looks amazing. Over 50 pieces of art from our fantastic Critter community will be on display there. If you're in the area, come check it out, hang out, run into other Critters. It looks to be a lot of fun this weekend, so hope to see you guys there. For more details on that, you can go to critrole.com/events. Then on January 19th, this Saturday, we're bringing back most of Vox Machina for our Search for Grog live show here in Los Angeles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Spoilers, he doesn't know yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry! Watch the last episode before coming to the show on Saturday. The VOD will be available in February. Check out critrole.com for the announcement and be sure to stay tuned for more info as it becomes available. All right, I believe--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've got one announcement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well then, throw it in there, Liam!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can't wait. The whole thing's going to vomit onto Netflix tomorrow. Check it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes to Carmen Sandiego, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think she likes Carmen Sandiego.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where in the world is-- no!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's such strong feelings.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, all of us had strong feelings when it comes to a capella. Don't we, Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Hmm-bop, boop ba doop a mmmbop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [water bubbling] [thunder] [explosion] (chanting) Role! Critical! Role! [dramatic Critical Role theme]

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Villains beware 'cause you're about to be dead.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) They got magic and flair, they got falchions and cunning. They don't see over there there's a monster incoming. Inspiration is waiting, rise up, don't think twice. Put your fate in your hands, take a chance, roll the dice! (chanting) Role! Critical! Role!

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can you answer the call? Diggin' deep in your soul as the legend unfolds. Now it's your turn to roll! [fire burning]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. I said "burglary taint." I was caught between two Carmen Sandiego things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For some reason, not as funny as just "bobs."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Getting creative now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're giving people a peek behind the curtain right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've been doing this for four years.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So last we left off, The Mighty Nein, after finishing their journey to the secondary temple of Uk'otoa's sealing, managed to deliver the second of the collected orbs and bring him one step closer to his release. You then exited back to your ship, which another ship was found to be giving chase, apparently notified by your presence from the large geyser that erupted from the ocean due to the unsealing. A short chase then commenced, leading to a much shorter battle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, next.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Disadvantage the whole game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. All said and done, hearing rumors about possible dangers continuing to push deeper into the empire from the Xhorhasian hordes, you begin to make your way back towards the direction of the empire. Getting your things in order, you've made your way back through the Swavain Islands and you are just now entering the port of Nicodranas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nicodranas!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach, Mighty Nein, what would you like to do? There's a person on the deck right now who's waving down and bringing you in, bringing out a spyglass to check your banner, your ship name. It looks like you're probably going to be in the process of checking in shortly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We forged those documents, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, we did. We forged them real good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What was the ship's name?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We never changed it; it's still The Balleater.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, just checking. That makes sense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I just got his name as Wharfmaster. Male dwarf, matted beard, thick gold hoops.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wharfmaster Ignus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right, Ignus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we making any attempt to hide our persons, disguise our persons?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think so, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Smart, smart, always smart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will Mask of Many Faces and give myself a bald head with a nice little red flavor saver right here, and very expensive red and gold-looking flowy stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, all right. Anybody else changing their appearance upon entry?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure. I'll go for my standard shaggy red-headed mess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I guess I'm going to be human with black hair instead of blue hair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's pick a different color.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What different color?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to be blue? Blue's a really good color.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe pink. Something that's like, "Oh, that's not a monster."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not ostentatious, or attracts attention at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really nice to look at. Like, "Look at that little pink girl!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. "That's a little pink pixie thing" or something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Someone might try to kidnap you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Give yourself wings!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wings?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, little cute dragonfly wings on you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The tiniest wings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Little teeney. You want dragonfly, or--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dragonfly wings, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six inches shorter, brown hair, no beard and brown robes, like the simplest student.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Understood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to put some makeup on Beau over here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I brush my hair.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who are you? My god, what happened to Beau?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to do Yasha's makeup again, but I'm not going to make her look like a snake person this time. This time she's going to look real cute. I'm going to put some red lipstick on her, and maybe put her hair in a topknot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha accepts, does not really care to see what it looks like, but just trusts your opinion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I grab one of Avantika's coats, rip the sleeves off of them, put it on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Avantika's coats don't have sleeves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My kind of woman.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Baller move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are brought into the side, the ship is brought up against the dock, a couple of dockhands start to go on and help get the ship pulled in, tied off. Planks are put down. Ignus eventually comes back over and goes, "All right, so tell me, "what is your ship? Paperwork, please!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is the Balleater. It's been quite a while since we were in Nicodranas. I'm Captain Tristan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Captain Tristan."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We will probably be here for, I don't know, an extended period of time. We might make our way up into the Empire. Do you have any extended rentals on the dock here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Captain, wasn't there a plan to run business in your stead?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm so forgetful. Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here's your documentation sir, Orly, sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the Wharfmaster. Misfires, finally.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he mocking Orly? Oh my god! The Wharfmaster's a dick!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He comes back. "Paperwork is all fine. All right, we will be talking." He points to Orly, and Orly gives him a nod. Looks back at the rest of you. "Well, you all be safe. Even if you got some "of that fancy m-m-magic word stuff, right?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I will definitely send you a message if we need anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can too, probably."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Awesome!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Y'all travel safe."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be well, Orly. Carry on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Take care of that crew, they're real good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't worry, I fully intend to," and puts a captain hat on.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I found it that way, though, so you should probably fix that while we're gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what would you like to do? Where are you off to?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to find a blacksmith.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You seem unreasonably excited about that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's been a while.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need any help? What, are you going to make something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pull out the broken sword hilt that I have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah, that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd love to see about getting this fixed, maybe, as a token of appreciation for Mr. Fjord for doing such a good job taking care of himself on his own quest and not getting sidelined into some bad thoughts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I also don't know how to find a blacksmith.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I think I know a pretty good one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Access the memory banks. (warbling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make a history check. As you, however, have not spent a lot of time traveling around Nicodranas, as much as you grew up here, you stayed indoors most of the time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know of a really good one! I rolled a four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know of a really good one in Zadash.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit, I think it's in Zadash. That's where I got that box made, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that metal box? Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, never mind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Metal box?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know, I've never had a metal box before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could probably ask around for a blacksmith.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you do with it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, I left it at the blacksmith.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, we're getting so afar. You just mimed a metal box.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's amazing. You're very talented.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go ask around for a blacksmith.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think Caleb had something to say.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about a place that has writing materials? Paper and ink and that sort of thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah, my mom was big on books.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a joke in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a little bit better. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have not been to a bookstore, necessarily. Most of the books that you had were brought to you by your mom, but you could probably wander around and find one eventually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll lead the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, are you guys beelining it to a bookshop, then?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we split off and some of us can look for a blacksmith and some can look for a bookshop and then we'll reconnoiter somewhere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If the people looking for a bookstore find a blacksmith, they can send a little Message, and if the people looking for a blacksmith find a bookshop, I assume we should buy everything we see.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure. I'll go to blacksmith with Caduce.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was going to lead Caleb to the bookstore.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go to the blacksmith with the guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you going to come along?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would love to come along, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's going to the blacksmith? Team blacksmith, you begin to wander through the streets, asking questions around. Eventually, some of the local zhelezo lead you over to the place called Ingots and Hammers. It seems to be a humble size, but this isn't a very big smithing town, necessarily. In fact, one of them you speak to goes like, "Port Zoon would be more the place to "go if you're looking for good, brawny blacksmiths, but there is Ingots and Hammers, maybe." They head you over in that direction. The exterior of it, most of it the heavy stone base of the building-- it's a standard rectangle, most of it open on the side facing the street so you can see the smoke from the forge itself pouring out. It doesn't have a specific chimney built more than it billows out in two places to create these two drifting streams that head up. As you walk up, you can see there isn't immediately work being done. It looks like perhaps there is a mid-afternoon break, and you do see a tan skinned, heavyset, burly looking fellow, human, smooth bald head, a split lip that healed back and it has this big scar piece that gives him a little bit of character, and he sits there in the middle of eating a bowl of fruit and glances up at you. "Hello? Can I help you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. I was looking to have a sword repaired, a very unusual sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me see it." He sets down his bowl and walks over. "Oh. Just a second, hold on." Sets it down and rummages through a small shelf unit in the back and pulls out a few books and pulls out one tome, opens it up and sets it down and begins thumbing through, page to page. Takes about five, six minutes to find something before he stops and goes, "My apologies. This is not really a form of "forging that I can repair. This is Uthudurnian."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Uthudurnian?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's a very far north, very isolated people. Dual society, dwarves and elves together."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Merger of the two styles of forging make for very unique weaponry, but a little bit "out of my skill range. My apologies."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that's good to know. Would you know of anyone who could point us in the right direction or would we have to probably venture that direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's north of the Empire."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: North of the Empire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Up in them Wildlands."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: North of the Dunrock Mountains, would you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, that's the place!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are here, and we got to go there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's barely two-and-a-half, three feet. I mean, what's the scale on that? It's like one-half scale, double?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hundred miles.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So, one, two-- in a straight line-- three, four, five, six, seven, eight hundred miles, if we fly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We may be sitting on this for a little while. That's good to know, thank you, friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Happy to help. Wish I could be of assistance, I could use the coin, but-- good luck."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, here's a couple coin for your trouble, anyway. I throw three gold at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three gold, he goes, "Thank you very much! You are very generous, thank you. Thank you all."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's your name, by the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dreef."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dreef?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dreef. What's your name?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beau."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Like a staff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you use staffs?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you sell staffs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, it'd be really funny if you used them, and you do, so that's quite funny."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You would call that the Beau bo.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would be Beau's bo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is what I'm talking about."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you all really just making this connection? Really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, truthfully, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pull out my bo staff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "Yeah."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On Beau's bo.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You could, yeah. Then it'd be Beau-bo-bows. Bo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wait." He turns around and rushes off real fast to rummage in the same cabinet and comes back with piece of ribbon, then leans in to tie it around the bo.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now that is something. Beau's bo's bow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "You're not into this, I'm sorry."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I put it away and I smack Fjord in the face as I put my staff back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Your lip's bleeding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The ribbon's for you, I suppose."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anyway. Have a good day!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You too, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good luck." He sits down and takes his bowl back on his lap and watches you intensely as you leave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's interesting. We have to take care of that at some point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it bigger?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's a little poofy. Yeah. That's a good one, man, I had good aim on that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Bookshop farers!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's this way. You just walk over here and then you go down this street.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like we've walked down this road before, at least twice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is exactly what we've done. You've been to this place before, but when you were a child? Maybe you've forgotten the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I never went here, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you get out? Did your mother take you around, or did you have maybe a babysitter?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Neither?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were just let up to your own devices as a small child?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I did see a bookstore, I swear, from my window.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About then, you pick up a visual on a cornershop that's called Front to Back and has books hanging underneath that on a little wooden placard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: See? This is what I was talking about, this one right here, Front to Back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before we go in: you never went out, or just rarely? You mean, just rarely went out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did go out sometimes, yeah. I got to go, you know, on errands sometimes, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's fun. Did you have many friends, growing up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Traveler's really cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) So tragic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. So you were starved for--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Bluud! I mean, you know, that guy, he hung out with me sometimes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The minotaur?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That must have been fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was, he let me hang on his horns.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about just outside of the Chateau? Did you go out to play?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, let's see what books they have inside here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You step inside. It's a smaller building and there's no other customers, it's actually pretty quiet in there. The only sound you hear is a silent purring from the owner's cat. It's curled up on one of the shelves and it's (purring). As soon as you enter and make your first creaking step against the floorboard, one eye pokes open, (yawns), stretches out, stands up and looks at you all, and then turns around and just walks away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What color was the cat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a desk towards the back where you see a scrawny, scrappy-looking man in his late 30s or early 40s. His hair is combed back, slicked, but little pieces of it are falling in front of his eyes. He has a little bit of scruff on his upper lip, not enough to actually be considered a mustache. He glances up from a book that he's in the middle of reading and goes, "Hello? Look "around, anything you want, I'm Rusan. Anything that you may require, let me know! Pay at the front."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before I step forward, I lean down to the ground, snap my fingers, and bring Frumpkin the cat into existence. Telepathically say: Go, say hello to that cat. And he scuttles off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (meows)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Russo, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Rusan."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rusan, oh. My apologies. I am looking to buy a bit of paper. Quite a bit, but whatever you might have. Also, do you specialize in a kind of book here, or is it a wide array? What's your specialty? What's your favorite that you have for sale?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That seems to be very popular among the visiting crownsguard. I mean, there's a lot of things! "Are you looking for something in particular?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: History of the area, of Nicodranas itself, I would be interested in reading. Anything you have of arcane nature, I would be especially interested in, even if it was just histories of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is a bit specific, unfortunately. We do not have anything in particular for that."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I will look through your fictional works and also history if you have it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know where we would go to find arcane books and stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Concord generally deals with things that are of particular price points and interests. I mainly "deal with people who come to travel in and out, people that want something to read when they are "going on a boat for a very long time. There's not a lot of business to be made from the books you requested."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Well, priority one is, I deal in prose and poetry quite a bit, so I need a good amount of basic blank paper for my work.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's a really good poet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It all rhymes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Have you been published?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am almost ready. I just have to take that first step--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Slam poetry, right now! Anything that comes to your mind!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (vocal accompaniment)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am pink. I sometimes stink. I need to think. I want to get out of this store right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And get a drink? A-wicka-record scratch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keep at it."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So just the paper, I suppose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey." He leans forward and pats you on the shoulder. "Everyone starts somewhere, right?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ooh. Now, DM question. I have that ink from the library that can take basic-ass paper and have it serve the purpose of 500 gold worth of that high-quality paper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I would like to buy that specific amount of paper. I want to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 500 gold-- I mean, to equivalent, to fill up that much ink--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The equivalent of, which would be much less, I assume.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Yeah. He has a fair amount of paper. Some of it, he seems to have to leave for a few minutes and then come back with it. He seems to be going off and probably buying it from other friends of his. Like the time I remember as a kid, I ordered a cheeseburger at a Mexican restaurant, and it took 30 minutes to get there, and I realized it was because they went up the street to get it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we make that, yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was a dumb 12-year-old. Anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While he is making those trips, I will find one interesting fictional work and also any history book on Nicodranas that I can find.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Front to Back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With typical ink or magic ink?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Typical ink.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two sailors, two separate ships that continuously meet up at different island ports throughout the Swavain Islands, eventually finding themselves on opposite sides of a conflict: one as part of the Revelry, and one that is part of the Clovis Concord's naval fleet. Yet these two sailors eventually come together and find that this conflict was not enough to keep their passions apart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Edubational.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find a book about the history of Nicodranas, and I'll email you information after the game. I don't want to sit here and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Please don't. But I do want to have that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, I'll send that to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would like to buy the book about cooking, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Which one? There are many types. There are ones that focus on various ways of steaming and "spicing vegetables, from Marquet. There are ones about the actual coastal tropical fruits that can "be prepared in a way that is more savory than sweet. What is your preference?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cinnamon in pastries.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That will be--" He goes and looks through his ledger, goes and pulls one off of the shelf, comes by. "This will be two silver pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you also have a book about mushrooms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are a few that contain mushrooms, I'm sure. I can look around."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would like one of those, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Any preference? I mean, there are-- location-wise?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Something where you can cook the mushrooms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, I'll pick one. All right, that will be four silver."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There you are. Your cinnamon pastry and mushroom book. Enjoy."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Great Nicodranas Bake Off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No worries. Well, good luck, and keep it up, my friend."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, what do I owe you? For all the paper, and these two books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right. "Each book is two silver pieces, so that's four silver pieces for that. For "the total amount of paper, that is going to run you about-- we'll say 25 gold pieces."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excellent. Okay, so I hand that over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a lot of paper.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are we going to stay tonight, do you think?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to put that in the bag?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That would be helpful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (paper sliding)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like feeding an endless printer, (paper sliding), or those dollar counter machines that go (dull whirring).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait, what did you ask me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we sleeping tonight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At the Lavish Chateau. Where else would we stay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I don't know--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it was a little contentious when we left, but I--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we hustled out of town because we had caused a ruckus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What difference does it make?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not for very much longer. Mine's going to wear off in a couple of minutes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Should we recast it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I recast it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll recast it, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Samesies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mark off another level one spell slot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shall we go home?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can contact the others.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a really high-level spell, but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you going to pick any fights with anybody today?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should have maybe said a place where we would meet later.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did, sort of, but they were walking away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to stay there tonight. I don't know for sure if that's happening, but I'm sure it'll be okay. Also, we get to see Nugget again--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll meet you there and maybe talk about tomorrow's thing. I think we're probably going to want to take a look at that tower while we're in town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have a "you can reply to this message," so you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love it. It's so good. As you guys finish your business, you all eventually come and reconvene. Unless you have other business you want to attend to while you're out and about?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the walk towards Mom's house, is there any little patch of grass or dirt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plenty of patches of dirt. I would say, in the streets--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A park that we pass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you go a little bit out of your way, yes, you can find a patch of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to-- maybe while they were in there shopping, I want to put my hand in the dirt, feel soil, know that I'm on solid land.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your fingers dig into the dirt and you squeeze it and appreciate it, you glance over to the side. There's a seven-year-old boy who's sitting there, looking at you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was looking for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He reaches down and grabs a big handful of dirt, too, and squishes it in his fingers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (mud squelch)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (crying)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, no. I thought we were playing! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "I thought we were playing!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A strange little pink creature with fairy wings just threw dirt in his eye.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sam attempted to have a dad moment, and it failed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so excited for our next campaign. You've already created a backstory for your next character.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. (deep voice) I hate monsters.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Little boy with a knife.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If it's pink, I kill it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a very unhealthy relationship with pink.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What would you like to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I look up into the rafters and see if Professor Thaddeus came home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, beat me to it. Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Even with a natural 20 I don't think I would see Professor Thaddeus, but I did not roll that. I rolled a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not see Professor Thaddeus in the rafters.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Too bad, man. That would have been really cool, huh?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It would have been so cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He flew the coop.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shame on you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was bad. I don't feel good about that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go running upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would have been so on brand for Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it would've.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leans back and folds his arms. Are the rest of you going up with her or staying down there?

lines.name: SAM, TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, no, if we're all here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Unless you want some privacy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, come!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all head up. Bluud puts his hand out, this big meaty hand, before the others and goes: "Jester?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leans back again, his shoulders hitting the wall as Jester does the classic international symbol for "let us through please."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Long established.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You come to the door?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She glances over and looks at--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Drop it. Mama!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Starts showering the top of your forehead and cheeks with kisses and goes: "Jester, you're back."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're back! We're pirates.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, these are your same friends?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Oh, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll drop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll drop our disguises.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you so much for taking care of my little sapphire."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How was the city when we left? Was everything okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Everything was fine. I was a little worried from the message that you told me, so I inquired "around. There was a disturbance. Apparently there was a ghost story, so thank you for "letting me know. But now you have a ghost story in Nicodranas."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! We're infamous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Especially in this world, it can be very dangerous."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do they know our names?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was more of a marauding band of murderers on "the ship side of the docks that stole a ship, but apparently killed a number of other illegal "peoples, and so they write it off as illegal people doing illegal things to illegal people."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we're good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just be careful. Anyway."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How's Nugget?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nugget?" (whistling) All of a sudden, right there in front of you, you see Nugget, but larger. Over the weeks that you've gone, the tiny puppy is now a fairly decent-sized puppy. Halfway to full grown, and even that's the size of a fairly big dog. Nugget (pants) and jumps up into your arms, and you fall back onto the ground as (slurping).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This dog got big!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi! Have you been training him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's been a bit of a handful, but is very adorable."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's so cute!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But are you taking him?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Of course we are!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wonderful! Wonderful. I am so happy to hear that. He's missed his mommy, haven't you? Haven't you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you're going to miss him, you know, you can--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No! No, it's quite all right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you sure, Mama?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is destiny, kismet. Please take him."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Can we stay here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course! Of course. I mean, here?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the rooms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, oh, of course. Hold on a second." She pulls Nadine over and they talk a bit, and Nadine checks and comes back up and says that there are only two rooms available for the evening that aren't already checked out. She goes, "If anyone needs to, they are welcome to stay in this room as "well, and the other two are at your disposal. I put them at my tab, do not worry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very gracious of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two rooms ought to cover it for us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just for the night?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long are we going to be-- maybe just a couple nights, maybe, at best. There's a few things we should do in town before we head--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know what we're doing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you want to stay for a while, though? A few days?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I don't want to impose or anything, you know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's not an imposition. I just need to make sure that there are rooms "available for each progressive night."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pardon me. After tonight, we could find another place, give you a day or two with your mother.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, I would not argue."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now that we're back on land, I feel better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is welcoming. Well, tell me, how was your time? Apparently you "left under interesting circumstances."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hurried circumstances, I think, would sum it up. We did have to borrow a boat. A ship.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We did not bring it back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We got another boat! It's way cooler.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're giving that one to Orly, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he's holding it for us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you familiar with Darktow Isle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have heard of it. There are stories, but I have not been there, of course."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Your daughter was very brave. Our adventure took us over there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, wow! Are you being serious right now?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Serious? We're pirates! Well, we were.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sounds like a very frightening place."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who was the client?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I cannot tell."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did he have hair from another guy on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was he bald? Was he big and bald?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, but that doesn't narrow down my clients, necessarily, either."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, well, we only met a couple people, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I don't think the Plank King leaves very often.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He could, my mom is really, really cool and worth traveling for.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Without a doubt. Our travels took us far and wide, and we are all the more excited to be back on land and to explore this beautiful city that most of us haven't had a chance to really peek about.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You two are very curious about that tower.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just, you know, as a historical landmark.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know that tower that gets bigger and smaller the closer you are to it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I assume that you're referring to the Tidal--"

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: The Tide Peak?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tide Peak? Yes. I have not been there, of course, but it is a mysterious place."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What have you heard about it, for Fjord and Beau's benefit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, as far as I know, there is a very wealthy mage who lives there who is responsible "for the organization of the Open Quay, who is kind of a hermit, from what I've heard, but is "supposedly at least looking out for the benefit of the people who live there so as not to be "completely under the control of the monopoly of the Concord. That's as much as I know."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That sounds like what we've gathered before. Interesting. I think that's where we want to go next. You notice as you walk towards it and walk further away, it looks like it grows and shrinks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a dick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I was going to say like a telescope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what I mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that's true, but I feel there's a difference.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Between dicks and buildings?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's different!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course, one is a building,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As an expert, I would say yes. Anyway."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know it goes up and down; it doesn't lay over on its side and shrink up and then extend itself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What happens in the cold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You have been at sea for quite some time, I can tell."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's really rampant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is all right. Well, take your time. I will ask to see if we can have a special dinner "prepared for you when you come back tonight, and I'm happy to have you home."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What time is it about now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, it's later afternoon. I'd say you probably have about another hour or so before dusk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think we should look at the tower.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go right now!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I used up three spells already.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So what? We'll be fine! There's nothing in there. We're just going to steal some stuff.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I make out, from the spine or the cover, what book she was reading that she set down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Books, books, books!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Really, really great for the DM!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. It's called Hireling, because that was the first word I saw on the back of my DM's screen. Who knows what that story's about?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the first chapter say?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's just a Player's Handbook.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first chapter's called "Obscured Areas: Lightly obscured has the effect of creatures--" (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's making a game system!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What class do you play?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester makes a valid point. We actually probably should go first thing in the morning so we're all nice and rested, and I would enjoy a nice meal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've got a little bit of time. We still don't know how to get into this tower. Maybe we could do a little bit more research before the night is out before dinner time?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go scope it out. Let's go stare at it a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ask questions? I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I dig it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bring the paint.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. The paint is always with me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: May the paint be with you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, I promise you, if we go scope it out tonight, we are going in tonight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think that is a good idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you met these people before?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would definitely prefer to wait as well. I'm a fan of taking a minute to take a look around and have a plan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've been going at an 11 out of ten for a while. We need to slow down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ms. Ruby, do you have any sorts of shops you might recommend that would have stuff of that nature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you're looking for general shops that have things that are useful in travels like that? "Healing potions, I don't really deal with those at all. There is The Seafloor's Bounty in the Open "Quay. If you're planning to go by the strange dick tower, then that is a possibility. If not there, "there is also Meandering Treasures in the Restless Wharf is a destination of interest, "if that's what you're looking for, odds and ends, maybe."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is no specialty stores in healing potions in Nicodranas."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sure either of those will do nicely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Good luck."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shall we? A little light shopping?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we take Nugget with us as we go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Please, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, maybe not into the stores with things that break and then we have to pay for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, we might be doing a covert walk-by of this place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good idea. But what if Nugget could go poof and go into it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That could definitely happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then we're like: Oh no, my dog! He went in and now I have to go in too to get him out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's valid.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's your call.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: TRAVIS' PHONE: I don't know how to respond to that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You beat me to it, Siri.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What lazy roleplaying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Yes, and," bitch! (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess we can leave him here for the time being.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, I'm going to stay here and do a little bit of reading, so if you want me to watch your dog, I will.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really? Do you want any company?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While I read?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Someone to stare over your shoulder and see what you're reading and talk to you while you're trying to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel a little uncomfortable. Who are we talking about? You?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I don't like to be near when he reads. He needs to focus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you sure Nugget won't bother you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but go, find out what you can about this place and get your shopping done. Ask about the tower. Subtly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you need anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mm, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (panting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to have a good time. Okay, bye!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Watch the dog. (poof)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dog immediately-- they both port in opposite directions as he ports right up next to you and pushes you over.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. You want to do some spell research with me? Come on. Come on, Frumpkin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin leaps up and perches around your shoulders, taking the territory and staring at Nugget.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't let him push you around. I start to read and write.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The rest of you, where are you going?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In the interest of time, are there any potions that we find around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have two locations you go to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Seafloor Bounty is over by the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we should go to the one in the Open Quay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, can I help you?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hello?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hello!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is she mocking me?

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we disguised still? We're not disguised anymore.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably not. Probably it wore off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think we need some items here. Why am I the face of the group? Hi! We need some items. We're looking for some potions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She leans over the top to look down at your also-tiny frame over the top. "You need potions, "you said?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Potions. I will also need some-- I was looking for some oil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oil?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some oil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can get you some oil, sure."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right! (increasingly shrill) And do you have any healing potions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (shrilly) We've got coin!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's the secret password! I'll be right back."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like she's mocking me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If anything, you're mocking her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She leaps off her stool and vanishes behind the counter. You hear the footsteps walk away and go into a back chamber, and you're left alone on the floor in the room for a second.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa. Do we see anything cool?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything interesting on the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's all sorts of interesting. Decorative scabbards containing what you assume to be a blade decorating the walls, you can see large conch shells and various sea trophies that were taken from people making the journey all across the Swavain Islands.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything shiny?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a few shiny things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just for fun, Detect Magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cast Detect Magic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything sparkly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around in the room, you get some faint magical glow or a sense from behind the counter. Nothing on display. There's probably a reason for that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair. Anything behind the counter look particularly interesting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to look over behind the counter?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I mean--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're tall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As long as I can-- I'm not going to break a rule or anything, but yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You glance over and look, and tucked underneath, there is a small wooden case. It's closed currently. It looks maybe about two foot by one foot, maybe six or seven inches high, and that's what's giving you the faint magical aura.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. A few moments pass and you hear some more footsteps come in, and another (heft) onto the stool again. She steps up and she has a small satchel that you hear the clanking of crystal or glass on the inside. "Okay, I have three healing potions I could muster. Is that what you want?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (louder) How much are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "60 gold apiece."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (quietly) That fair?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll take them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Pay up!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll buy one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. Anybody else chipping in?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll chip in for this, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't need them. I can heal people on my own.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, we should distribute them to other people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll chip in for one, 60 gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, that's a good point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll chip in for-- how many do we have now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just the three basic potions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Three basic healing potions. I'll chip in for one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's buy them out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have any flammable oils?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's oil. How much do you need?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Enough for a larger flask. Something that I could make a long line of oil with, if I needed to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, that'll run you 40 gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance around the corner and there's a slight curtain, and it looks like she's just emptying out lanterns into a vial. Just pouring one after another, after another into this small jug, and eventually corking it. Comes out, "Careful, now!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're welcome. Thank you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is your name again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sheila."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sheila.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sheila Bobsnopper."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sheila Plobs--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bobsnopper."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bobsnopper.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Miss Sheila, I had a question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's your question?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was curious about any magical items you might have for sale. I got a vibe that you might have something here that might be interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nothing for sale, sorry."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have anything that's not for sale, that's just for show?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not for show!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you have that's secret?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "None of your business!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Trust me, you don't want to be the kind of person that comes in here and gets a chance to see it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's a weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a wand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't play this game, missy!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that a yes or no on the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you casing my joint?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hmm?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I said, are you casing my joint?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you--" (grunt)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is casing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you buy things as well, ma'am?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, I do. What, do you have something to sell?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have some studded leather armor that I don't need any more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh! Show it to me."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here's some old studded armor. Studded leather.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's a good set, not too bad. For sale..." Let me look at the price here. (singing) Studded leather armor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Says 45 on-- That's new, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll give you 15 gold for it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, here you go."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh, it hurts me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take 15 gold back. She goes and throws it in a pile in the corner. "Is that it? "Anything else?" She narrows her eyes at you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (grumpily) No. Nothing else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Narrows even harder at you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think she likes us, Caduceus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's nonsense, we're very likeable. Is there something in your eyes? Do you have a problem, I can--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you tired? Are you falling--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I like you. You, you can all piss off!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is why you did the talking. Have a nice day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We chose wisely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bye, bye!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice to meet you, whatever, bye-bye! I liked her, she was nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A real spitfire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She was great. Bobsnopper?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bobstomper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bobsnopper.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got a feeling she had more fight in her than you'd think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I bet she could do some damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So before the sun goes all the way down--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to sneak into her shop and steal what's behind the counter?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was going to say let's go look at the tower.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could probably kill her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love the prospect of you finally coming back to Nicodranas and immediately just fucking everything up again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Everything's chill.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do what you want, mind you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a holdup! Empty your wallets!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Why not embrace destiny?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's make our way over to the, what was it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Wayfarer's Cove-- The Open Quay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're in the Open Quay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Tide Peak. The tower, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Easy to find, the tower is visible. By now, at this point in time, the sun is in the process of setting, so the sky has transitioned now into its vibrant oranges and reds, and across the way on the other side of the horizon the dark blues and purples are starting to take. But there it is, the dark shadow of the monolithic tower of Tide Peak, visible. The closer you get, the taller it becomes, and the taller it becomes, until what looks to be maybe hundreds of floors up. It's absurd how tall it looks from the base floor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How wide is it, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it's maybe no more than 50 feet across, 50 feet wide.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't you have an ability where you can disappear and reappear a few feet somewhere else?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could you not do that and just be quickly inside?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if you get stuck?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I look up, is that balcony that we saw before about 15, 20 feet above our heads?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That balcony is not visible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you mean? It's not there anymore?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we do that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did what? Make it appear? And disappear?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do a quick speed round, and we walk around the perimeter looking out for fucking windows and balconies and we meet around the other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Yeah, you go around, and where the balcony was last time, there's nothing. It's solid. In fact, there are no windows for about 60 or so feet up, and then you see a balcony similar to the one you saw, but it is shorter, like truncated on each side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. How high up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 50 or 60 feet up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 50 to 60. Yeah, that's too high. I mean, I can get up there, but it makes a real big noise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you could just disappear and reappear inside the wall, couldn't you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I don't know what's inside there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, could you get stuck?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just from my simple knowledge of basic physics.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just a caveman.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No doors, nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But hey, there's nothing that says if we come back in the morning, that son of a bitch might be in a different place, I'll bet you, crackfire, slopdolly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hick queens?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (spits)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dimplewood!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Pick wood!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I get this feeling that this is all a forced perspective thing, like an illusion. What if we get in there and it's actually just a shack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no way. That's not possible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe he's an enthusiast of tiny homes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And it just looks like it grows and shrinks and grows and shrinks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Compensating.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. Just a theory.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't get up there without making a real loud ruckus, so tomorrow morning's our best bet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester could get us up there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not here, but just out of curiosity: The change in size, is it slight, that you just barely notice it, or is it like, "Whoa, whoa!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's, "Whoa, whoa!" unless you're watching it the whole time. So it's like, "Oh, we'll head "that way," and you walk, and all of a sudden you're at the base and you look up and you're like, "Whoa, why is it so tall?" If you're watching it, which I imagine you probably were, as you were heading through the Open Quay, it's pretty immediate, meaning within about 500 feet or so the transition really hits. From any distance in the city it just looks like any other large tower, though it looks like one of the more visible and apparent ones across the skyline. It isn't until you get within 500 feet that all of a sudden it drastically seems to grow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So its impressiveness is in the extreme when you're right there with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caduceus has a tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the tree?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Blink? Oh, that's fucking hot when you put a hot thing in it! Ow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Metal is funny when it conducts heat. Oh Laura, you okay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the tree?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caduceus, don't you have a magic tree?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, unless you haven't gone with them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was trying to remember if we'd split for the two-- I do have a magic tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But how does that work?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I drop it on the ground and a 60-foot tree immediately appears.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Immediately?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wouldn't that be a bit obvious?

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not if we ride it up to the top, then leave someone behind to chop it down real quick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a five foot thick, tall tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a shitty plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, what do we want out of this, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To be inside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but then what? To immediately be arrested and thrown out of Nicodranas?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Profit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, there's no rule that says don't ride up a tree and jump on a fucking balcony.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, there definitely is. It's called breaking and entering. There is a rule about that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't we just knock on the door?

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM
lines.text: There's no door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't we just knock on the wall?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Try it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you knock on the wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's it sound like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It sounds like you're knocking on hard stone, and it hurts your knuckle a little bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I turn around and look at the storefront-- Unless something happens when she knocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment, nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any that are obviously still open? Right across from, maybe that are facing the...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is one that looks to be a small fish market. It's not huge by any means, it looks like it's open, but it's probably going to be closing fairly soon, probably when the sun goes--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I just jog over and try and find somebody that might be working a desk over there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: While he does that, I'm going to just walk the tower with my hand on the tower and see if I feel any change at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're doing that, you hear a door (creaking) on the opposite side on the tower.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sound of running feet) Walking casual.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you hear it slowly open up, this little hand curls around the outside. Short, maybe around knee-height for you, Fjord. As the door peeks open, you see a male goblin, really well dressed, in a tiny little accountant's outfit, where it's double-breasted to one side with a nice lapel. Has small spectacles across the bulbous and pointed nose. No hair. The teeth-- which characteristically of a goblin tend to overlap and protrude-- have been really well-kept. Very well-groomed goblin! Pokes around the corner, "Hello?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can I help you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can he help us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We were hoping to make an appointment with--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With Yussa. Yussa Errenis. It would be really fantastic to talk to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you have an appointment?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We were going to make one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. Or at least if you can inform us how to make an appointment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He relaxes a second after the chest is puffed up, his presentation relaxes and the gut (puffing) underneath the outfit as he no longer feels that he needs to put on a presentation. He goes, "Well, let me take a look at the book. Hold on just a second." He closes the door behind him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we still see the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the door, yeah. It wasn't there when you walked around previously.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's his assistant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does the door look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like a standard door. It's circular at the top. It looks like it's wood slats, metal crossbars hold it all together. There's no handle or knocker. It appears to only open from the inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What knockers! Young Frankenstein, just to be clear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah. A few moments pass. The door opens up again and he has a tiny leather journal and he, "All right, soonest that we've got here--" pulls it back, "The soonest we've got here-- let's see, "about 17 months, three weeks, and four days."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it possible to maybe move that up into a very quick emergency meeting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's the emergency?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have to leave town and will not back for quite a while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, come back in a number of months--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's time sensitive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could all be dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check. Actually, no, make a deception check because this is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have genuine questions for this person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you're pushing that this is an emergency. Do you consider it an emergency?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For the things I want? Okay, I'm boasting a little. Deception, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to call you on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, that's fair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm boasting a little.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (mistrustful noise)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does the Blooming Grove mean anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not to me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it might to the dude you work for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Listen. I'm sure you've heard about the war that's happening in the Empire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have reason to believe that people with magical interests might be threatened in this time of war and having heard that "Ooh-sah" might be a man magical prowess, we thought that he might have some information or at least we could hand off our fair warning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll tell you what,

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Door closes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tomorrow morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm at the fish mart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm at the fish mart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, jesus!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With an axe in your hand going, "Who are you?!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fishmonger at the fish mart right now is going like, "I know, it's fucking weird, right? "It scares me. I don't like it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't see a particular door that appears every couple of days or is there a pattern?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. It does when they come in and out, but then it's gone. It's really creepy. I don't like it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything else that you can share that might help me understand this structure more?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (coos) What does the guy look like? (coos)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pigeons! Really unsanitary for these fish.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I want to help you. I can say that there is a very nice special on red snapper."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, for the entire fish, we're looking at least three silver."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll flip him four silver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, there you are." It's a sizable snapper.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, you probably haven't had meat in quite a while because I haven't been cooking it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wrapped in the paper stuff, right? Or is it just the fish?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For the extra silver, you get paper."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wraps it up for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very appreciative. You have yourself a fancy fucking evening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, the door is closed and you guys look back and Fjord approaches holding a fish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Success!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh good!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's a red snapper. Anybody a fan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mom loves it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You missed a bunch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it turns out you could just knock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We talked to a little goblin accountant dude. Made an appointment for tomorrow morning, but not really an appointment, an off-the-books appointment.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Haven't we been through enough that the jokes are unnecessary at this point?

lines.name: SAM
